summary: Third-party litigation financing is an arrangement in which a funder who is not a party to the lawsuit agrees to help fund it. Funders may get a pay off on their investment if the suit is successful. Funders are typically private firms that obtain funds from investors. title: Third-Party Litigation Financing: Market Characteristics, Data, and Trends
